title: Longtime Putin critic explains what has to happen for Putin's inner circle to turn on him
description: CNN's Paula Reid talks to longtime Putin critic and former chess champion Garry Kasparov about concerns around potential escalations in Ukraine, including the potential for Russia to use nuclear options.

title: Injured, alone and destined for a Russian orphanage, a 12-year-old Ukrainian girl is recruited for Moscow's information war
description: Before Russia's war on Ukraine began, Kira Obedinsky was a joyful, loved 12-year-old girl. Now orphaned, injured and alone in a Russian-controlled hospital in eastern Ukraine, she has become an unwitting pawn in Moscow's information war.

title: See what foreign leader said after meeting with Putin
description: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer said Russian President Vladimir Putin "believes he is winning" after he met with the Russian leader to confront him over his actions in Ukraine. Retired Major General Dana Pittard breaks down his remarks.

title: 'Most horrifying thing I've seen in my life': Zelensky responds to video
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky discussed a horrific video of a Ukrainian mother mourning after finding her dead son in a well.

title: Anthony Edwards inspires Timberwolves to shock Game 1 playoff win over Grizzlies
description: A devastating NBA playoff debut from Anthony Edwards powered the Minnesota Timberwolves to a shock 130-117 Game 1 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies on Saturday.

title: 1 person arrested in connection with South Carolina mall shooting that left 14 people injured, police say
description: One person has been arrested in connection with a mass shooting at a South Carolina mall Saturday that left 14 people hurt, police said.

title: Pope Francis calls out 'cruel and senseless war' in Easter message
description: Pope Francis says the world is marking an "Easter of war," and called for peace in Ukraine during his Easter Mass in St. Peter's Square.

title: 'I'm shocked I have clothes on too': Pop star hosts 'SNL'
description: Lizzo talks about being nervous hosting "Saturday Night Live" and rumors about her love life.

title: Black women fear the steady rise in abortion restrictions across the US will worsen maternal health crisis
description: Mckayla Wilkes remembers repeatedly complaining of shortness of breath to her doctors during her entire pregnancy seven years ago.

title: Ukraine rejects deadline to surrender in Mariupol as Russia threatens to eliminate resistance
Ukrainian tennis players live 'parallel lives' at the Billie Jean King Cup
description: Wearing a shirt decorated with the Ukrainian flag in the shape of a heart, Lyudmyla Kichenok practiced her serve with teammate Dayana Yastremska in an empty arena under the watchful eyes of their captain Olga Savchuk on Thursday.

title: Photo shows launch of N Korea's new weapon
description: South Korea says that North Korea launched two projectiles on Saturday. North Korea claims it was a new tactical guided weapon. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores another hat-trick to lift Manchester United's top four hopes
description: Cristiano Ronaldo scored his second Premier League hat-trick in three games to fire Manchester United to a 3-2 victory over Norwich at Old Trafford on Saturday, strengthening the club's bid to qualify for the Champions League.

title: This boy's lemonade stand raised nearly $2,000 for Idaho Humane Society
description: A 9-year-old boy's love of cats inspired him to raise almost $2,000 for the Idaho Humane Society.

title: 2 juveniles killed and at least 9 others shot in the East Allegheny area of Pittsburgh, officials say
description: Two young people were fatally shot and at least nine others were injured by gunfire overnight in Pittsburgh's East Allegheny neighborhood, officials said early Sunday morning.

title: 11-foot hammerhead shark washes up on Florida beach
description: An 11-foot hammerhead shark washed up on a beach in southern Florida, much to beachgoers' surprise.

title: Florida man watches 'Spider-Man' movie 292 times, setting new world record
description: A Florida man has won back a world record after watching "Spider-Man: No Way Home" 292 times.

title: Ukraine wants the world's largest plane to fly again. Here's what it will take
description: The images of the wrecked Antonov AN-225 are now an indelible memory for aviation enthusiasts worldwide.

title: Arthur Rupe, record producer who helped popularize R&B, has died at 104
description: Arthur Rupe, a record producer and 2011 inductee to the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, died Friday at his home in Santa Barbara, California, according to a statement from the Arthur N. Rupe Foundation. He was 104.

title: The oldest known gorilla in the world just turned 65
description: Fatou, a western lowland gorilla believed to be the oldest in the world, just celebrated her 65th birthday at the Berlin Zoo.

title: Eggs are a symbol of new life but they also have lots to say about the past
description: Eggs have been laid on land by birds, reptiles, dinosaurs and a few oddball mammals for more than 200 million years.

title: 'SNL' brings out Dr. Fauci, Marjorie Taylor Greene and Trump for Easter messages
description: "Saturday Night Live" opened up its episode this holiday weekend with the Easter Bunny, who had some special guests to pass on some special holiday messages.

title: North Korea conducts weapon test
description: North Korea fired two projectiles into waters off the east of the Korean Peninsula Saturday evening, according to the South Korean military, the country's 12th such weapon test this year.

title: Parts of New Mexico under evacuation orders as McBride Fire grows to more than 6,000 acres
description: The deadly McBride Fire in southern New Mexico grew to more than 6,100 acres Saturday and evacuation orders remained in place in several areas, officials said.

title: He went missing nearly 3 years ago. Deputies found him shivering outside a gas station 700 miles away
description: Authorities in Summit County, Utah, had been hearing about a young man wandering the area with a shopping cart for several weeks.
